interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Black Nativity
Review Date: 2014/10/08
Store: Forest Whitaker  (Actor),     Angela Bassett  (Actor)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ["In a contemporary adaptation of Langston Hughes' celebrated play, the holiday musical drama BLACK NATIVITY follows Langston (Jacob Latimore), a street-wise teen from Baltimore raised by a single mother, as he journeys to New York City to spend the Christmas holiday with his estranged relatives Reverend Cornell and Aretha Cobbs (Forest Whitaker and Angela Bassett). Unwilling to live by the imposing Reverend Cobbs' rules, a frustrated Langston is determined to return home to his mother, Naima (Jennifer Hudson). Langston embarks on a surprising and inspirational journey and along with his new friends, and a little divine intervention, he discovers the true meaning of faith, healing, and family."]
Average Rating: 4.7

reference_summary:
Crooklyn [DVD]
Alfre Woodard  (Actor),     Delroy Lindo  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['Product Description', 'Make yourself at home with the Carmichael family as they experience one very special summer in their Brooklyn neighborhood that they\'ve affectionately nicknamed "Crooklyn." Renowned director Spike Lee fashions a bold, flavorful picture of family life that People Magazine calls his "most affectionate work." Academy Award® nominee Alfre Woodard stars as Carolyn, a loving, but fiercely independent mother who along with her musician husband (Delroy Lindo) struggles to raise her family in difficult but often wonderful circumstances. Complemented by an energizing, vintage R&B soundtrack, this tender, colorful film is a fitting tribute to an American family.', 'Bonus Content:', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Cast and Filmmakers', 'Cast and Filmmakers', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "Spike Lee's semiautobiographical, 1994 film about the good and bad times for a Brooklyn family in the '70s has passion and nostalgic good feeling, but it is also a mess of random reflections and arbitrary storytelling. The centerpiece of the movie is a little girl (Zelda Harris) who views the ups and downs of her parents' experiences (mom and dad are played by Delroy Lindo and Alfre Woodard), and who navigates the life of her neighborhood. Lee tosses in a lot of '70s detail (watching", 'The Partridge Family', ") and other diversions (Harris's journey through suburbia), but he has no master sensibility controlling the flow of it all. The film is more wearying than anything, although bright spots include Lindo's fine performance as a talented man suffering from irrelevance.", '--Tom Keogh']
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2020515', 'Director': 'Spike Lee', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Anamorphic, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Dolby', 'Run time': '1 hour and 54 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 1, 2015', 'Actors': 'Alfre Woodard, Delroy Lindo, Spike Lee, David Patrick Kelly, Zelda Harris', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Spike Lee', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Joie Susannah Lee, Cinque Lee, Spike Lee', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
One of my favorite films from my chilhood. My mom loves this movie. We had it on VHS and it didn't work anymore,

Unwilling to live by the imposing Reverend Cobbs' rules, a frustrated Langston is determined to return home to his mother, Naima (Jennifer Hudson). profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Film Preference:** Enjoys nostalgic and family-oriented films with meaningful storytelling and inspirational narratives.
- **Sentimental Value:** Strong emotional connections to childhood favorites, particularly those highlighting family dynamics and values during the holiday season.
- **Director Interest:** Prefers works by notable directors recognized for cultural significance and relatable narratives, such as Spike Lee.
- **Actor Appreciation:** Favors performances by respected actors, showcasing a particular admiration for notable performances in family-centric dramas (e.g., Forest Whitaker, Angela Bassett).
- **Home Media Format:** Prefers physical media formats, specifically collecting DVDs, indicating a nostalgic appreciation for tangible assets in film.
- **Ratings Behavior:** Tends to rate favored films highly, reflecting a positive disposition towards content that resonates personally, as shown by recent high ratings.
- **Cultural Elements:** Interested in narratives capturing specific cultural and temporal settings, enhancing the viewing experience with themes of faith, healing, and family connectedness.

Overall, this user values heartfelt stories that intertwine family experiences with broader cultural themes, especially those that resonate with holiday spirit and personal significance. Their recent experiences reinforce a continued appreciation for films that feature compelling casts and uplifting messages in relatable settings.
